pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.2.eng: At that time the monks stored one of their robes with other monks and then left to wander the country in a sarong and an upper robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.3.pli: Tāni cīvarāni ciraṃ nikkhittāni kaṇṇakitāni honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.3.eng: Because they were stored for a long time, the robes became moldy.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.4.eng: The monks put them out in the sun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.5.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā ānando senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto te bhikkhū tāni cīvarāni otāpente.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.5.eng: Then, while walking about the dwellings, Venerable Ānanda noticed that the monks were sunning those robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.6.pli: Disvāna yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmato ānandassa etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.8.eng: And they told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.9.eng: Venerable Ānanda complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.10.eng: “How can those monks store a robe with other monks and then leave to wander the country in a sarong and an upper robe?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando te bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.11.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha. Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā bhikkhūnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.15.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.17.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.18.1.pli: “Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattampi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.18.1.eng: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe season has ended, if a monk stays apart from his three robes even for a single day, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.19.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.19.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kosambiyaṃ gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.1.eng: At one time a certain monk at Kosambī was sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.2.pli: Ñātakā tassa bhikkhuno santike dūtaṃ pāhesuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.2.eng: His relatives sent him a message, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.4.eng: The monks urged him to go,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.6.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.7.eng: that you can’t be apart from your three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.9.eng: I’m unable to travel with my three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.12.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.13.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānassa bhikkhuno ticīvarena avippavāsasammutiṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.13.eng: “Monks, I allow you to give permission to a sick monk to stay apart from his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.14.eng: And it should be given like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.15.pli: Tena gilānena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.15.eng: After approaching the Sangha, the sick monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.17.eng: I’m unable to travel with my three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.18.pli: Sohaṃ, bhante, saṅghaṃ ticīvarena avippavāsasammutiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.18.eng: I ask the Sangha for permission to stay apart from my three robes.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.19.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.21.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.22.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.24.eng: He is unable to travel with his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.25.eng: He is asking the Sangha for permission to stay apart from his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.26.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno ticīvarena avippavāsasammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.26.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give permission to monk so-and-so to stay apart from his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.28.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.30.eng: He is unable to travel with his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.31.eng: He is asking the Sangha for permission to stay apart from his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.32.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno ticīvarena avippavāsasammutiṃ deti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.32.eng: The Sangha gives permission to monk so-and-so to stay apart from his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.33.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno ticīvarena avippavāsasammutiyā dānaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.33.eng: Any monk who approves of giving permission to monk so-and-so to stay apart from his three robes should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.34.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.35.pli: Dinnā saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno ticīvarena avippavāsasammuti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.35.eng: The Sangha has given permission to monk so-and-so to stay apart from his three robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.36.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.38.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.38.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.39.1.pli: “Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattampi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:2.39.1.eng: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe season has ended, if a monk stays apart from his three robes even for a single day, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.2.pli: bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvarāsā vā upacchinnā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.2.eng: the monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth has been lost, destroyed, or burned; or his expectation of receiving further robe-cloth is disappointed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.2.comm: This refers to the robe-cloth received during the robe season. For details see Kd 7:1.7.3–13.2.7.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.4.pli: aṭṭhannaṃ mātikānaṃ aññatarāya mātikāya ubbhataṃ hoti, saṅghena vā antarā ubbhataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.4.eng: it has ended according to one of the eight key phrases or the Sangha has ended it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.4.comm: For an explanation of this see Kd 7:1.7.3–12.1.37 and Bi Pc 30:1.1.8.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.5.eng: If a monk stays apart from his three robes even for a single day:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.6.pli: saṅghāṭiyā vā uttarāsaṅgena vā antaravāsakena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.6.eng: from the outer robe, the upper robe, or the sarong.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.7.eng: Except if the monks have agreed:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.10.eng: it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.11.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.11.eng: The robe should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.12.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.13.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.14.pli: “idaṃ me, bhante, cīvaraṃ rattivippavutthaṃ aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.14.eng: ‘Venerables, this robe, which I have stayed apart from for one day without the agreement of the monks, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.15.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.1.18.eng: ‘I give this robe back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.1.eng: An inhabited area may have a single access or many;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.1.comm: For the rendering of upacāra as “access” and gāma as “inhabited area”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.2.eng: a house may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.3.eng: a storehouse may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.4.eng: a watchtower may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.5.eng: a stilt house may have a single access or many;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.5.comm: I have here included three kinds of building—the māḷa, the pāsāda, and the hammiya—into one category, “stilt house”. See below for further discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.8.eng: a boat may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.9.eng: a caravan may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.10.eng: a field may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.11.eng: a threshing floor may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.12.eng: a monastery may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.13.eng: a dwelling may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.14.eng: the foot of a tree may have a single access or many;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.2.15.eng: out-in-the-open may have a single access or many.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.1.eng: “An inhabited area with a single access” refers to the following.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.2.pli: ekakulassa gāmo hoti parikkhitto ca. Antogāme cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antogāme vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.2.eng: An enclosed inhabited area belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept within the inhabited area, one must stay within the inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.3.pli: Aparikkhitto hoti, yasmiṃ ghare cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ ghare vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.3.eng: An unenclosed inhabited area belonging to one clan: one must stay in the house where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the house.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.3.comm: “Of the house” is added from the commentary. Sp 1.477: Hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbanti atha vā taṁ gharaṁ samantato hatthapāsā na vijahitabbaṁ, “Hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṁ: or one is not to go beyond arm’s reach from any point of that house.” Without this explanation it is hard to make out whether the arm’s reach is from the house or from the robe. In each instance below I have added the respective commentarial explanation, so as to make it clear what the arm’s reach relates to.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.4.pli: Nānākulassa gāmo hoti parikkhitto ca. Yasmiṃ ghare cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ ghare vatthabbaṃ sabhāye vā dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.4.eng: An enclosed inhabited area belonging to many clans: if the robe is kept in a house, one must stay in that house, in the public meeting hall, or at the gateway to the inhabited area, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the public meeting hall or the gateway.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.4.comm: Sp 1.479: Tattha saddasaṅghaṭṭanena vā janasambādhena vā vasituṁ asakkontena sabhāye vā vatthabbaṁ nagaradvāramūle vā. Tatrapi vasituṁ asakkontena yattha katthaci phāsukaṭṭhāne vasitvā antoaruṇe āgamma tesaṁyeva sabhāyadvāramūlānaṁ hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṁ. Gharassa pana cīvarassa vā hatthapāse vattabbameva natthi, “If one is unable to stay there because of the impact of noise or being confined by people, one should stay in the public meeting hall or at the main gateway to the town. If one is also unable to stay there, one should stay in a comfortable place wherever. Then, before dawn, one should go there, or one should not go beyond arm’s reach of that meeting hall or of the main gateway to the town. But there is no staying within arm’s reach of the house or the robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.5.pli: Sabhāyaṃ gacchantena hatthapāse cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā sabhāye vā vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.5.eng: If one puts aside the robe within arm’s reach while going to the public meeting hall, one must stay in the public meeting hall, or at the gateway to the inhabited area, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.5.comm: Sp 1.479: Purimanayeneva sabhāye vā vatthabbaṁ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṁ, “According to the previous method, one should stay in the meeting hall or at the main gateway, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.6.pli: Sabhāye cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā sabhāye vā vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.6.eng: If the robe is kept in the public meeting hall, one must stay in the public meeting hall, or at the gateway to the inhabited area, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.6.comm: Sp 1.479: Sabhāye nikkhipitvā pana sabhāye vā tassa sammukhe nagaradvāramūle vā tesaṁyeva hatthapāse vā aruṇaṁ uṭṭhāpetabbaṁ, “But having put it aside in the public meeting hall, dawn should arrive (while one is) in the meeting hall, in its presence, at the main gateway to the town, or within arm’s reach of these.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.7.pli: Aparikkhitto hoti, yasmiṃ ghare cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ ghare vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.3.7.eng: An unenclosed inhabited area belonging to many clans: one must stay in the house where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the house.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.1.pli: Ekakulassa nivesanaṃ hoti parikkhittañca, nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Antonivesane cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antonivesane vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.1.eng: An enclosed house belonging to one clan and having many rooms: if the robe is kept in the house, one must stay within the house.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.2.pli: Aparikkhittaṃ hoti, yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.2.eng: An unenclosed house belonging to one clan and having many rooms: one must stay in the room where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the room.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.2.comm: Sp 1.480: Hatthapāsā vāti gabbhassa hatthapāsā, “Hatthapāsā vā: beyond arm’s reach of the room.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.3.pli: Nānākulassa nivesanaṃ hoti parikkhittañca, nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.3.eng: An enclosed house belonging to many clans and having many rooms: if the robe is kept in a room, one must stay in that room, or at the main entrance, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.3.comm: “The main entrance” renders dvāramūle. Sp 1.480: Sabbesaṁ sādhāraṇe gharadvāramūle, “At the base of that door of the house which is common to all.” And then: Hatthapāsā vāti gabbhassa vā gharadvāramūlassa vā hatthapāsā, “Hatthapāsā vā: beyond arm’s reach of the room or the main entrance to the house.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.4.pli: Aparikkhittaṃ hoti, yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.4.4.eng: An unenclosed house belonging to many clans and having many rooms: one must stay in the room where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the room.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.1.pli: Ekakulassa udosito hoti parikkhitto ca, nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Antoudosite cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antoudosite vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.1.eng: An enclosed storehouse belonging to one clan and having many rooms: if the robe is kept in the building, one must stay within the building.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.1.comm: “Storehouse” renders uddosita. Sp 1.482: Udositoti yānādīnaṁ bhaṇḍānaṁ sālā, “An udosita is a shed for goods such as vehicles, etc.” | Sp 1.482: Ito paṭṭhāya ca nivesane vuttanayeneva vinicchayo veditabbo, “Starting from here, the judgment is to be understood by the same method as in regard to a house.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.2.pli: Aparikkhitto hoti, yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.2.eng: An unenclosed storehouse belonging to one clan and having many rooms: one must stay in the room where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the room.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.3.pli: Nānākulassa udosito hoti parikkhitto ca, nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.3.eng: An enclosed storehouse belonging to many clans and having many rooms: if the robe is kept in a room, one must stay in that room, or at the main entrance, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.4.pli: Aparikkhitto hoti, yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.5.4.eng: An unenclosed storehouse belonging to many clans and having many rooms: one must stay in the room where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the room.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.6.1.pli: Ekakulassa aṭṭo hoti, antoaṭṭe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antoaṭṭe vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.6.1.eng: A watchtower belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept in the watchtower, one must stay within the watchtower.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.6.2.pli: Nānākulassa aṭṭo hoti, nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.6.2.eng: A watchtower belonging to many clans and having many rooms: one must stay in the room where the robe is kept, or at the main entrance, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.7.1.pli: Ekakulassa māḷo hoti, antomāḷe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antomāḷe vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.7.1.eng: A stilt house belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept in the stilt house, one must stay within the stilt house.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.7.1.comm: The māḷa, here rendered as “stilt house”, is hard to distinguish from the next two buildings, the pāsāda and the hammiya. In fact, according to Sp 1.482 they are all different kinds of pāsāda, that is, different kinds of “stilt houses”: Māḷoti ekakūṭasaṅgahito caturassapāsādo. Pāsādoti dīghapāsādo. Hammiyanti muṇḍacchadanapāsādo, “A māḷa is a square stilt house with (a roof in) a single peak. A pāsāda is a long stilt house. A hammiya is a stilt house with a bald roof.” Rather than try to name each of these buildings, which in any case would not be useful for practical purposes, I have instead grouped them together as “stilt house”. For practical purposes, what these three buildings have in common—and this is what distinguishes them from the buildings at Bu NP 2:3.4.1–3.5.4, the nivesana and the uddosita—is that they do not have an enclosed category. For a discussion of the pāsāda, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.7.2.pli: Nānākulassa māḷo hoti nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā, yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.7.2.eng: A stilt house belonging to many clans and having many rooms: one must stay in the room where the robe is kept, or at the main entrance, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.8.1.pli: Ekakulassa pāsādo hoti, antopāsāde cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antopāsāde vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.8.2.pli: Nānākulassa pāsādo hoti, nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.9.1.pli: Ekakulassa hammiyaṃ hoti, antohammiye cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antohammiye vatthabbaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.9.2.pli: Nānākulassa hammiyaṃ hoti, nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Yasmiṃ gabbhe cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ gabbhe vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.10.1.pli: Ekakulassa nāvā hoti. Antonāvāya cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antonāvāya vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.10.1.eng: A boat belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept on the boat, one must stay on the boat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.10.2.pli: Nānākulassa nāvā hoti nānāgabbhā nānāovarakā. Yasmiṃ ovarake cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ ovarake vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.10.2.eng: A boat belonging to many clans and having many rooms: one must stay in the room where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the room.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.11.1.pli: Ekakulassa sattho hoti. Satthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā purato vā pacchato vā sattabbhantarā na vijahitabbā, passato abbhantaraṃ na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.11.1.eng: A caravan belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept within the caravan, one must not go further than 80 meters in front of or behind the caravan, and no further than 11 meters from either side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.11.1.comm: “80 meters” and “11 meters” render seven abbhantara and one abbhantara respectively. For further discussion of the abbhantara, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.11.2.pli: Nānākulassa sattho hoti, satthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā hatthapāsā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.11.2.eng: A caravan belonging to many clans: if the robe is kept within the caravan, one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the caravan.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.11.2.comm: Sp-ṭ 1.489: Satthoti jaṅghasattho sakaṭasattho vā … satthe cīvaraṁ nikkhipitvā hatthapāsā na vijahitabbanti ettha hatthapāso nāma satthassa hatthapāsoti veditabbaṁ, “Caravan: a caravan of walkers or a caravan of carts … If the robe is kept within the caravan, one must not go beyond arm’s reach: here arm’s reach is to be understood as arm’s reach from the caravan.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.1.pli: Ekakulassa khettaṃ hoti parikkhittañca. Antokhette cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antokhette vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.1.eng: An enclosed field belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept within the field, one must stay within that field.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.2.eng: An unenclosed field belonging to one clan: one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.2.comm: Sp 1.490: Aparikkhitte cīvarasseva hatthapāso, “When it is unenclosed, it is just arm’s reach from the robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.3.pli: Nānākulassa khettaṃ hoti parikkhittañca. Antokhette cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā dvāramūle vā vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.3.eng: An enclosed field belonging to many clans: if the robe is kept within the field, one must stay at the entrance to the field, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the entrance or the robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.3.comm: Sp 1.490: Nānākulassa khette hatthapāso nāma khettadvārassa hatthapāso, “In a field belonging to many clans, arm’s reach means arm’s reach from the entrance to the field.” Sp-ṭ 1.490: adds: Dvāramūlato aññattha antokhettepi vasantena cīvaraṁ hatthapāse katvāyeva vasitabbaṁ, “For one who is living within the fleld, but not at the main entrance, one should stay within arm’s reach of the robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.4.eng: An unenclosed field belonging to many clans: one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.12.4.comm: Sp 1.490: Aparikkhitte cīvarasseva hatthapāso, “When it is unenclosed, it is just arm’s reach from the robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.13.1.pli: Ekakulassa dhaññakaraṇaṃ hoti parikkhittañca. Antodhaññakaraṇe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antodhaññakaraṇe vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.13.1.eng: An enclosed threshing floor belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept on the threshing floor, one must stay on that threshing floor.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.13.1.comm: For the threshing floor and the next category of monastery, arm’s reach has the same meaning as for a field. Sp 1.491: Dvīsupi khette vuttasadisova vinicchayo, “Also in regard to the two, the judgment is just the same as said in regard to a field.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.13.2.eng: An unenclosed threshing floor belonging to one clan: one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.13.3.pli: Nānākulassa dhaññakaraṇaṃ hoti parikkhittañca. Antodhaññakaraṇe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā dvāramūle vā vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.13.3.eng: An enclosed threshing floor belonging to many clans: if the robe is kept on the threshing floor, one must stay at the entrance to the threshing floor, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the entrance or the robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.13.4.eng: An unenclosed threshing floor belonging to many clans: one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.14.1.pli: Ekakulassa ārāmo hoti parikkhitto ca. Antoārāme cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antoārāme vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.14.1.eng: An enclosed monastery belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept within the monastery, one must stay within that monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.14.1.comm: Ārāma could be rendered as “park”, which is the more fundamental meaning of the word. However, since such parks were sometimes given to the Sangha to serve as monasteries, as in Anāthapiṇḍika’s ārāma, the monasteries too became known by the same name. It is the latter meaning which predominates in the Vinaya Piṭaka.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.14.2.eng: An unenclosed monastery belonging to one clan: one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.14.3.pli: Nānākulassa ārāmo hoti parikkhitto ca. Antoārāme cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā dvāramūle vā vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.14.3.eng: An enclosed monastery belonging to many clans: if the robe is kept within the monastery, one must stay at the entrance to the monastery, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the entrance or the robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.14.4.eng: An unenclosed monastery belonging to many clans: one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.1.pli: Ekakulassa vihāro hoti parikkhitto ca. Antovihāre cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antovihāre vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.1.eng: An enclosed dwelling belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept within the dwelling, one must stay within that dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.1.comm: Sp 1.493: Vihāro nivesanasadiso, “A dwelling is like a house.” In other words, it is to be treated like a house for the purposes of this rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.2.pli: Aparikkhitto hoti, yasmiṃ vihāre cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ vihāre vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.2.eng: An unenclosed dwelling belonging to one clan: one must stay in the dwelling where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of that dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.3.pli: Nānākulassa vihāro hoti parikkhitto ca. Yasmiṃ vihāre cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ vihāre vatthabbaṃ dvāramūle vā, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.3.eng: An enclosed dwelling belonging to many clans: one must stay in the dwelling where the robe is kept, or at the main entrance to the dwelling, or not go beyond arm’s reach of either.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.4.pli: Aparikkhitto hoti, yasmiṃ vihāre cīvaraṃ nikkhittaṃ hoti tasmiṃ vihāre vatthabbaṃ, hatthapāsā vā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.15.4.eng: An unenclosed dwelling belonging to many clans: one must stay in the dwelling where the robe is kept, or not go beyond arm’s reach of the dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.16.1.pli: Ekakulassa rukkhamūlaṃ hoti, yaṃ majjhanhike kāle samantā chāyā pharati, antochāyāya cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā antochāyāya vatthabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.16.1.eng: At the foot of a tree belonging to one clan: if the robe is kept within the area of the midday shadow of the tree, one must stay within that area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.16.2.pli: Nānākulassa rukkhamūlaṃ hoti, hatthapāsā na vijahitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.16.2.eng: At the foot of a tree belonging to many clans: one must not go beyond arm’s reach of the robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.16.2.comm: Sp 1.494: Idhāpi hatthapāso cīvarahatthapāsoyeva, “Also here arm’s reach is just arm’s reach from the robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.17.1.pli: Ajjhokāso ekūpacāro nāma agāmake araññe samantā sattabbhantarā ekūpacāro,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.17.1.eng: Out-in-the-open with a single access: in an uninhabited area, in the wilderness, the area covered by a circle with 80 meters radius has a single access.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.17.1.comm: “Out-in-the-open” renders ajjhokāsa. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.17.2.eng: Whatever lies beyond that has many accesses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.1.pli: Vippavutthe vippavutthasaññī aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.1.eng: If he has stayed apart and he perceives that he has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.2.pli: Vippavutthe vematiko, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.2.eng: If he has stayed apart, but he is unsure of it, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.3.pli: Vippavutthe avippavutthasaññī, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.3.eng: If he has stayed apart, but he does not perceive that he has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.4.eng: If it has not been relinquished, but he perceives that it has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.5.eng: If it has not been given away, but he perceives that it has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.6.eng: If it has not been lost, but he perceives that it has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.7.eng: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives that it has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.8.eng: If it has not been burned, but he perceives that it has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.9.pli: avilutte viluttasaññī, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.9.eng: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.10.pli: Nissaggiyaṃ cīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.10.eng: If he uses a robe that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.11.eng: If he has not stayed apart, but he perceives that he has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.12.eng: If he has not stayed apart, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.18.13.eng: If he has not stayed apart and he does not perceive that he has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.19.2.pli: antoaruṇe paccuddharati, vissajjeti, nassati, vinassati, ḍayhati, acchinditvā gaṇhanti, vissāsaṃ gaṇhanti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.19.2.eng: if before dawn it has been relinquished, given away, lost, destroyed, burned, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.19.2.comm: “Taken on trust” refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.19.3.eng: if he has the permission of the monks;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.19.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:3.19.6.eng: The training rule on storehouses, the second, is finished.
